Economics Festival is the %1$s dedicated to the %2$s, held in Trento (Italy) from May 30 to June 3.

The UI an logic of the app is based on the Google IO 2018 official app. The source code (written in Kotlin), on the other hand, is mostly written from scratch.\nThe app is based on the MVVM pattern and makes use of the following libraries: Android Material, Architecture and Navigation Components, Kotlin coroutines, Firebase Firestore and authentication UI, Dagger2, Google Maps, ThreeTenAbp, Glide, Lottie animations.
The app is open source and can be found at this %s.
Show times in the event\'s time zone
Receive notifications 1 hour before favorite events begin
Trento is on the Verona-Brennero-Monaco axis. All trains to and from Verona and Bolzano stop in Trento. There is a direct link with Venice-Mestre; Valsugana-Bassano; Grappa-Castelfranco Veneto.

A22 Brennero motorway. Take the exit at Trento Sud (approx. 90 km from North Verona) or Trento Nord (58 km from Bolzano); taking SS no. 12 at Abetone-Brennero, along the Valle dell'Adige. 

Coming from Padova, Bassano, Belluno, take the SS no. 47 at Valsugana (super-highway), while for those arriving from the Lombard zone of Lago di Garda, take the SS no. 45bis at Gardesana occidentale. 

For more information call the toll-free number 800 994411 run by the Autonomous Province of Trento or visit www.viaggiareintrentino.it.

The nearest airports are in Bolzano (60 km), Verona (97 km), Treviso (140 km), Brescia-Montichiari (160 km), Venice (173 km), Milan Linate (223 km), Milan Malpensa (250 km), Bergamo Orio al Serio (180 km), Bologna (220 km), and Innsbruck (177 km).

All the Festival venues can be reached easily on foot. The Festival provides bicycles free of charge at the Bicigrill in Piazza Fiera. \n\nThe historic centre is a traffic-restricted area (ZTL) where circulation of vehicles is prohibited at certain times. In the town paid parking spaces are indicated in blue (between 8.00-19.30 on weekdays, Saturdays included).

%1$s: via Petrarca, Lungadige San Nicolò, via R. da Sanseverino. 

%2$s: in Lungadige Monte Grappa, Via Alfieri, Via Bernardo Clesio and Corso degli Alpini, in the ex Zuffo piazzale, near the Shuttle Bus stop, paid parking. 

For more information contact the %3$s in Trento-Monte Bondone, Tel. +39 0461 889111.

Parking area Camper via Fersina nord - 33 places max 48 hours, toilets for the disables, hot water, camper service - http://www.trentinomobilita.it 

Piazzale area ex Zuffo – near the Trento Centro tollgate (exit closed inbound from motorway): 19 places, parking and camper service, paid parking.

Piazzale Sanseverino. 

Parking area Campo Coni - via E. Maccani: 10 places. 
Villazzano - Via Asiago: in the train station car park: 6 places.

the ex Zuffo parking area near the Trento Centro tollgate (exit closed inbound from motorway) 
Monte Baldo parking area at the junction between Monte Baldo and Via Sanseverino 
Ghiaie c/o PalaTrento parking area on Via Fersina 
Piazzale Sanseverino 
ex Sit area in Via Canestrini 
parking near Piedicastello (Galleries) 

Ex Zuffo – Monte Baldo – Ghiaie (c/o PalaTrento) are linked to the city by the following buses: the ex Zuffo parking area by the Parking Shuttle Bus and by Bus 2 every 10 minutes mornings and evenings and every 15 minutes at all other times; Monte Baldo by the Parking Shuttle Bus, as often as every 10 minutes during rush hour. The parking area PalaTrento by Bus A and the Parking Shuttle Bus every 15 minutes.

Autosilo Buonconsiglio, via F. Petrarca, 1/5 (00.00–24.00 every day): 400 places 
Centro Europa, via Segantini, 7 (7.00–20.30 closed on public holidays): 500 places 
Autorimessa Europa(attended), via Roggia Grande, 16 (Monday–Friday 7.30–20.00, Saturdays 7.45–12.45 and 14.45–19.30, closed Sundays and public holidays): 100 places 
Parcheggio Piazza Fiera, piazza Fiera (0.00–24.00 every day): 460 places 
Garage Torre Verde (attended), via Torre Verde, 40 (weekdays 7.00–21.00, holidays 8.00–10.00 and 20.00–21.00): 60 places 
Parcheggio Duomo, piazza Mosna, 1/A (Monday–Saturday 7.00–20.30, closed holidays): 197 places 
Parcheggio Palazzo Onda, via Zambra (Monday–Saturday 8.00–20.00, closed holidays): 170 places 
Parcheggio Trento Fiere – via Briamasco, 2, for cars and vans: 250 places

The %1$s can accommodate disabled persons. 

The %2$s managed by the HandiCREA Cooperative on Via S. Martino, 46 (Tel. +39 0461 239396 - info@handicrea.it- www.handicrea.it), open from 8.30 – 12.30 and from 13.30 – 17.00 Monday to Friday, provides information on the services available to disabled persons and on the accessibility of tourist and other amenities. 

For more information: www.ttesercizio.it

As always, entry to all events is %1$s. No reservation is required. \n\nAccess to the events scheduled at the %2$s takes place with vouchers, distributed at the ticket offices starting two hours before the start of each event.

The focus of the 14th edition of the %1$s in Trento is: “%2$s”. Every year, Nobel prize winners and internationally-renowned scholars, politicians, intellectuals, economists, trade unionists and journalists, discuss and debate with the audience of the festival on extremely important and contemporary issues. \n\nAmong others, %3$s from Berkeley will talk about universal basic income; %4$s e %5$s about the origins of sovereignism and populism; %6$s will question the relationship between globalization and inequality, %7$s about the risks of secular stagnation in advanced countries, %8$s will talk about the sustainability of Italian public debt.
continue to read the editorial by Tito Boeri…

Una selezione di film con riferimento tematico esplicito al mondo economico e culturale, occasione per discutere e commentare passaggi cruciali della storia, della politica e della morale del "fare economico".
Due punti di vista diversi, due modi opposti di guardare a un problema, due possibili alternative per risolverlo.
I protagonisti del mondo dell\'impresa, della ricerca, dei media, della politica discutono le questioni calde dell\'economia.
Dalla storia alla sociologia, alla filosofia, quanto e cosa le altre discipline hanno da dire sulla realtà economica
Come in un dizionario minimo, i termini fondamentali per orientarsi e farsi un\'opinione.

Nella storia si ritrovano le radici e le ragioni del presente. Lo sguardo rivolto agli eventi del passato, nel nuovo formato del Festival dell\'Economia, offre un\'ulteriore prospettiva dalla quale trarre indicazioni per la migliore comprensione del tempo che viviamo. Con la partecipazione di alcuni tra i migliori e più rappresentativi storici della tradizione di studi del nostro paese.
Gli ospiti e i temi, i libri e le testimonianze, gli appuntamenti del Festival raccontati ogni giorno in diretta.
L\'analisi economica applicata alle vicende più significative dell\'attualità.
Esperienze intellettuali, scelte di vita, racconti in prima persona dalla viva voce di chi li ha vissuti
Il nostro presente e il nostro prossimo futuro nelle parole di grandi personalità della cultura internazionale.
…Alan Krueger Lecture, Alla Frontiera, Discussions, EconoMia, Meetings With Authors, Inet Panel
